content: sock pm pick up and knit 14 16 18 20 sts along the right side of your heel flap knit across your 10 10 12 12 heel sts then the 14 16 18 20 you picked up to bor round 1 decrease round knit to marker sm k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before bor k2tog k1 round 2 knit round with no decreases repeat rnds 1 and 2 until you are back to original stitch count of 56 64 72 80 sts foot knit to desired length trying sock on until the end is just beyond your pinky toe or until you are about 1 short of the desired length the craft yarn council https //www craftyarncouncil com/standards/foot-size-charts provides the following guidance for how long a foot is based on shoe sizes multiply the desired length by 0 9 to get a length with 10% negative ease so for a women s size 9 5 at about 10 you should knit the foot to about 9 women s 4-6 5 8-9 7-9 5 9 25-10 10-12 5 10 25-11 men s 6-8 5 9 25-10 9-11 5 10 25-11 12-14 11 25-12 toe you should still have markers dividing heel and instep stitches placed when setting up the gusset or these divisions should be marked by needle changes if using dpns or magic loop round 1 decrease k1 ssk knit to 3 sts before marker k2tog k1 sm twice round 2 knit round with no decreases repeats rnds 1 and 2 4 4 5 5 times there should be 40 48 52 60 sts remaining repeat round 1 4 5 5 6 times there should be 24 28 32 36 sts remaining graft the toe closed using kitchener stitch
